HEA_composition.catalyst_name: High Entropy Oxides with Oxygen Vacancies (HEOs-Ov)

synthesis.precursors: Metal nitrates (Co, Mn, Fe, Ni, Zn) mixed in ethanol solution, followed by solvothermal treatment

TEM.particle_size_nm: Not specified, but core-shell structure confirmed
TEM.dispersion: Uniform distribution of metals and oxygen vacancies

XPS.peak_shift: Decreased valence states of Co, Mn, Fe, and Ni after introducing oxygen vacancies

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Core-shell structure with uniform distribution of metal elements in the core and oxygen vacancies
physicochemical_characterization.EPR: Stronger signal for HEOs-Ov, indicating abundant oxygen vacancies

commercial_RuO2.overpotential_trend: RuO2 shows lower overpotential than HEOs at low current densities, but higher at >15 mA/cm²

electrochemical_performance.mass_activity_A_mg: Not specified but higher for HEOs-Ov compared to HEOs
electrochemical_performance.stability: HEOs-Ov maintained stable performance for 200 hours at 10 mA/cm² with no significant degradation

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: The oxygen vacancies in HEOs-Ov promote *OH adsorption and deprotonation, facilitating the OER process through the Adsorbate Evolution Mechanism (AEM).
